title: Is it some kind of Bodoni? Or Clarendon?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Acne_logo_2013-02-14511c5ea514e846-75834778_4090.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/what-the-font_5412.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_mxds13brrs1qdzixxo1_1280_4755.png)

Font: 

 Times Modern, Dala Floda 

Solved By: 

 [Birdseeding](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024/http:/typophile.com/user/88704 "View user profile.")
author: stakaludens

comments.content: I know the Acne Jeans logo [used to be based on a typeface called Times Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/3368/the-other-times-modern) that has not been digitised, and since has become a customised piece of lettering. The other two typefaces (all three are distinct, btw.) I don't know, but I'm sure someone will help presently.
Oh! Surprisingly it is Times Modern. Thank you!
The second one, the stencil, is Commercial Type's [Dala Floda](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/dala_floda).

Third one is a bit hard to tell (small size, difficult angle), but it could be [Caslon Graphique](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414183024/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/%28caslon+graphique%29/fonts/). Except that doesn't have an italic...
